explanation: The bug was a mistaken use of the equality operator '==' instead of the assignment operator '=' when trying to mark a consumed item as removed. The line `item[(now[0],now[1])] == 0` performs a comparison and does nothing, so the item remains available repeatedly. I replaced it with `item[(now[0],now[1])] = 0` to correctly set the item to 0 (consumed). Only that single line was changed.
